Overall, this laptop stand does the job, but there‚Äôs definitely room for improvement. The hinges are a bit too loose, which affects the stability but after placing laptop  it doesn't slips out of position. 

The rubber tape is  attached but not good  as advertised . I think it will be gonna deatached out soon

If the hinges were tighter, this would easily be a 5-star product.

For the price, this laptop stand is decent but has some drawbacks. While functional, it‚Äôs not the most durable option. The paint tends to chip off easily, and the rubber pads on the feet wore out fairly quickly. 
I'd recommend setting it up in a fixed spot rather than moving it frequently to prolong its lifespan.

working fine. But I don't suggest to buy if your laptop is heavier than 1.5KG or bigger in size than 13 inch. it's good for MacBook and similar laptops. you cant move it from one to another position normally, if you do so your stand might get broken or your laptop may get damaged. so if you can fix your laptop in one place and your table is placed in the corner of your room then you can be benefited by this product otherwise don't buy it.

Overall build quality is nice for the price. My only gripe is the slider feet which is inserted in one of the 7 holes is made of plastic. Making it as critical point of failure. As the whole laptop weight stands on it, there is high to medium change of breakage within a year. Rest of the build is aluminum and decently sturdy. A good product nonetheless if you intend to use for a year or two at decentish price.

Bought it about 2 weeks ago and have been using it for a while. While most of the reviews here found it good, I didn't. For me, the product felt not well-engineered. The axes of the hinges are not sturdy and the handles kept slipping from their holes whenever I had to do micro-adjustments to the laptop. Don't get me wrong -- the stand handles any weight of the laptop because it's made from metal and can give the keyboard a much needed slope to make it easy to write. But the lack of sturdyness of the stand and the small width of the stand make typing hard because the laptop felt wobbly. If you are going to attach an external keyboard, then this product might be a good buy as you won't be touching a laptop. But, if you are going to be typing on the laptop then you are going to not like it.

PS: My laptop is a 15.6 inch laptop and I bought this laptop mainly so that the keyboard will feel inclined and the sharp edges of the laptop wont hurt my hand.
